conclusion: The problem involves analyzing a graph showing the relationship between terminal voltage \\( U \\) and current \\( I \\) for a battery and a resistance.

The graph has voltage \\( U \\) on the vertical axis and current \\( I \\) on the horizontal axis. Line \\( a \\) represents the battery's \\( U-I \\) relationship under a specific light intensity, and line \\( b \\) represents the \\( U-I \\) relationship for a resistance \\( R \\).
Line \\( a \\) is not a straight line due to the non-constant internal resistance of the battery.
Line \\( b \\) is a straight line with a positive slope representing the \\( U-I \\) relationship for a resistance \\( R \\).
The internal resistance of the silicon photocell can be determined by analyzing the intersection of line \\( a \\) with the axes.
The point where line \\( a \\) intersects the \\( I \\)-axis gives the short-circuit current \\( I_{sc} \\).
The point where line \\( a \\) intersects the \\( U \\)-axis gives the open-circuit voltage \\( U_{oc} \\).
The internal resistance \\( r \\) of the silicon photocell can be calculated using the formula: \\( r = \frac{U_{oc}}{I_{sc}} \\).
By substituting the values from the graph, we can find the internal resistance \\( r \\).
The internal resistance of the silicon photocell is 2 ohms.
